cells.data:
### 'My' notation and conventions

* $W_{n,k}$ (or $W_k^n$) is the **real** (_compact_) manifold of _orthonormal_ $k$-frames in $\mathbb{C}^n$:$$W_{n,k}:=\frac{U(n)}{U(n-k)}.$$
* This is _homotopic_ to the space of $k$-frames (i.e. there is a homotopy retract from the latter to the former given by Gram-Schmidt 'with a global parameter), where the space of $k$-frames can be described by ... TODO
* We transgress $c_k$ of a rank-$r$ bundle to $\H^{2k-1}(W^r_{r-k+1};\mathbb{Z})$

### Other notations

* In [BM96] _they_ write $W_{n,k}$ to mean what _we_ call $W_{n,n-k}$, i.e. $$W^\text{BM}_{n,k}:=\frac{U(n)}{U(k)}$$ but our notation agrees with Fuchs and Viro, Wikipedia (...), etc.

### Special cases

|$W_{n,k}$|$k$|Notes|
|-|-|-|
|$\mathbb{R}^{2n-1}\setminus{(0,\ldots,0)}$|1|this is the non-unital version of $S^{2n-1}$|
|$\mathrm{SL}_n(\mathbb{C})$|$n-1$|it is a principal homogeneous space for $\mathrm{SL}_n(\mathbb{C})$ (diffeomorphic to $\mathrm{SL}_n(\mathbb{C})$)|
|$\mathrm{GL}_n(\mathbb{C})$|$n$|it is a principal homogeneous space for $\mathrm{GL}_n(\mathbb{C})$ (diffeomorphic to $\mathrm{GL}_n(\mathbb{C}))$|

### Homology, cohomology, and dimension

* Fuchs and Viro's Topology II, Theorem III.3.2.A, page 218 (Springer)![IMG_20181010_182515222.jpg](quiver-image-url/10E3A97FCDB9FD82BED841710166887C.jpg =3120x4160)
* top degree is the sum of all the degrees, i.e. $2n-(2k-1)+\ldots+2n-1$
* TODO: specific case of $W^r_{r-k+1}$
